results.title: Blood of Dracula
results.creator_credit: Herbert L. Strock, Herman Cohen and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Six weeks after her mother dies, Nancy Perkin’s father remarries, and she is reluctantly sent off to boarding school. There she falls under the evil spell of a teacher, who hypnotises her, converting Nancy to vampirism! In the third instalment of his horror trilogy (that includes “I was a teenage werewolf” and “I was a teenage Frankenstein” both 1957), producer Herman Cohen continues to trade on the themes of teen disenchantment and conflict between the rock and roll generation and their square parents. There is even a proto-feminist theme in this film, borne out by the ambitious teacher who seeks to prove herself in a man’s world. Predictably she meets a sticky end, not only as the villain of the piece, but also perhaps as a warning to meddlesome females.

results.title: The Other sister
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Alex Rose, Mario Iscovich and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: When a mentally challenged young woman returns home from an institution, she craves independence not willingly granted by her loving but overprotective mother. After meeting a mentally handicapped man, Carla experiences romance and the desire for a life unencumbered by others’ limited expectations of her. Cast includes Juliette Lewis, Diane Keaton, Tom Skerritt, Giovanni Ribisi, Poppy Montgomery, Juliet Mills.

results.title: Love laughs at Andy Hardy
results.creator_credit: Willis Goldbeck, Robert Sisk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This post-WWII film of the Hardy family reflects the true-life situation of Mickey Rooney as he plays G.I. Andy Hardy returning from his tour of duty at the war. The Hardy family represents the “typcial” stereotype American family with Andy a typical American teenager, interested in cars and girls, his stern but understanding father Judge James Hardy (Lewis Stone) and his dear loving mother Mrs Hardy (Fay Holden). When Andy finds himself falling for the lovely college co-ed Kay Wilson (Bonita Granville), little does he realise what disappointments lay ahead. Delightful, light-hearted romantic comedy based on the characters created by Aurania Rouverol. Cast also includes Sara Haden, Lina Romay and Dorothy Ford.

results.title: Lilacs in the spring
results.brief_description: Based upon the stage production of Robert Nesbitt’s “The Glorious days” by Harold Purcell with original music by Harry Parr Davies. This is a song and dance romantic comedy set in London during WWII starring the ever-charming somewhat older Errol Flynn, along with Anna Neagle, David Farrar, Kathleen Harrison, Peter Graves and Helen Haye.

results.title: Horowitz in Moscow
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Robert Dalrymple, Camivideo and Columbia Artists
results.brief_description: This video celebrates the return of Vladimir Horowitz to his home country, the Soviet Union, in 1986 to perform a musical recital at the Moscow Conservatory. It was to be the first important event in a series of cultural exchanges agreed to at the Geneva Summit in 1985. Horowitz calls himself an “ambassador of peace” as he talks to the media, his fans and his family. The biographical documentary captures the emotions of both Horowitz and his adoring fans as he performs some of his favourite compositions by such composers as Mozart, Chopin and Rachmaninov, among others. Interspersed throughout this demanding performance are images of Moscow, the people, streets and cityscape along with insightful interviews with Horowitz as he reminisces about his past. An absorbing and thoughtful documentary featuring some wonderful solo music played by one of the world’s best and highly regarded pianists.

results.title: Unfaithfully yours (1984)
results.creator_credit: Howard Zieff, Marvin Worth, Joe Wizan, Daniel Melnick and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1948 Preston Sturges classic stars Dudley Moore as the symphony conductor who imagines ways to get back at the wife he believes is unfaithful to him. As his jeaslousy escalates, the disastrous after-shocks provide an arrary of farcical situations as Claude lays traps, fantasizes about double murder and sets about stalking his prey. Also stars Armand Assante and Natassja Kinski.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Michael White and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: The Last flight of Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Charles Jarrott, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: When a vintage B-29 bomber strays from its course over the Pacific, its crew - a high-living pilot, a prim missionary and two stowaway orphans - is forced to beach it on an unmapped tropical island. Stranded, they plot their way back to civilization. Stars Elliott Gould, Genevieve Bujold, Ricky Schroder, and Vincent Gardenia.

results.title: Insomnia (1997)
results.creator_credit: Erik Skjoldbjaerg, Tom Remlov, Tomas Backstrom, Petter Borgli, Nordic Screen Production AS and Norsk Film
results.brief_description: Edgy police thriller set in Norway and the original version of this title. A police detective (Stellan Skarsgard) is flown in from Sweeden to a small rural town in Norway to help solve the murder of a teenage schoolgirl. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. Tense and brooding the film questions the role of police as the enforcers of the law when they themselves are not above its constructs. Co-written and directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg this is a compelling first-time feature. Cast includes Sverre Anker Ousdal, Bjorn Floberg, Gisken Armand, Maria Bonnevie.

results.title: Tin men
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A tale of two hustlers in competition with each other, one a smooth-talking ladies’ man, the other a loser surrounded by debt and emotional problems. Set in 1960s Baltimore, BB Bakowsky (Richard Dreyfus) and Ernest Tilley (Danny De Vito) are rival aluminium siding salesmen brought together through an unfortunate car accident. Each blames the other and a full-on feud ensues. Revenge becomes a game and BB succeeds in making life even more complicated when in order to infuriate Tilley, he attempts to sleep with Tilley’s wife, Nora (Barbara Hershey) only to end up falling in love with her. Although the dialogue is fast and furious with many hilarious scenes there is sense of a darker sadder story underneath. Cast includes John Mahoney, Seymour Cassel, Jackie Gayle.
